snippet: The state is in the midst of a sweeping criminal investigation into 15 of its largest mental health providers, suspected of defrauding Medicaid of $36 million over three years.
abstract: New Mexico is in midst of a sweeping criminal investigation into 15 of its largest mental health providers, suspected of defrauding Medicaid of $36 million over three years; Arizona companies have been hired to fill in, but many patients are struggling without regular treatment; New Mexico Gov Susana Martinez is under sharp attack but state officials say they had no choice but to suspend care when extent of abuse became evident.
lead_paragraph: The state is in the midst of a sweeping criminal investigation into 15 of its largest mental health providers, suspected of defrauding Medicaid of $36 million over three years.

headline.main: Fraud Investigation Unsettles Mental Health Care in New Mexico
headline.print_headline: Fraud Investigation Unsettles Mental Health Care in New Mexico
